article.title: Permanent_autonomous_zone
article.text:
{{short description|Region autonomous from its surrounding state or nation}}
{{No footnotes|article|date=February 2008}}

A '''permanent autonomous zone''' ('''PAZ''') is a [[community]] that is [[autonomy|autonomous]] from the generally recognized [[State (polity)|state]] or authority structure in which it is embedded. PAZs are not controlled by any government (as recognized by other governments) or by any [[religion|religious]] authority.{{citation needed|date=February 2012}}

== Applications ==

The phrase ''permanent autonomous zone'' has been applied to groups such as:{{Citation needed|date=February 2009}}

* An autonomous, [[collective]]ly run community center
* A community living space: [[commune (intentional community)|communes]], [[squatting|squats]], self-sustaining [[village]]s, [[treehouse]]s
* [[Independent school]]s and/or [[Anarchistic free school|free school]]s, self-education centers
* A [[community garden]] or [[Open space reserve|greenspace]], efforts to preserve nature
* A non-authoritarian news organization, publisher, low power or [[pirate radio|pirate radio station]], [[infoshop]], [[internet service provider]], or other [[non-profit]] group that provides a service to the community
* Collectively run organizations or networks that promote non-hierarchical principles and localized autonomy
* Any continuous space, group, [[cooperative|co-op]], or individual effort accessible to a community that is founded on [[anti-authoritarianism|anti-authoritarian]] principles and autonomy within an egalitarian community.

== Current examples ==
*The [[Rojava Revolution]] is an ongoing social revolution in Northern Syria based upon regional autonomy and influenced by [[anarcho-communist]] principles, as exemplified by the [[Democratic Federation of Northern Syria]]. 
*The [[Rebel Zapatista Autonomous Municipalities]] (independent Zapatista communities, MAREZ from their name in Spanish) in the [[Mexico|Mexican]] state of [[Chiapas]]. Established following the 1994 Zapatista uprising, these communities operate, in practice, outside of Mexican law. They are governed internally by [[Councils of Good Government|"Good Government Councils"]] composed of community members and also often by weekly general assemblies open to all members of the community. Each community also sends delegates to a regional council in order to report decisions made in their respective communities. 
*[[Freetown Christiania]], is a partially self-governing neighbourhood in the city of Copenhagen, Denmark, which has established semi-legal status as an independent community.
*[[Dreamtime Village]], is a [[hypermedia]] [[permaculture]] [[eco-village]] project in southwestern Wisconsin, where the [[PAZifesto]] was first written & published as a broadside in an edition of 500.
*[[PAZ Ecovillage]], is an oasis of biodiversity in the [[Chihuahuan Desert]] near [[Terlingua, Texas]] that represents a Permanent Autonomous Zone that is dedicated to self-reliance, self-expression, sustainability, freedom, and peace from the conventional standards of society by utilizing the [[path of least resistance]]; the natural environment, conserving its resources, and living in cohesion with the Earth while maintaining a general consensus based community of dwellers and free thinkers.
*The [[Zone to Defend]] (or ZAD (French: zone à défendre) in French), a militant occupation that is intended to physically blockade a development project, notably the one located in the commune of [[Notre-Dame-des-Landes]] in France.
*[[Black Bear Ranch]], an intentional community governed by consensus in Siskiyou National Forest of northern California.

== Former examples ==
* The [[Paris Commune]], as well as short-lived counterparts declared in other French towns in 1870-71.
* The Ukrainian [[Free Territory]]
* [[Shinmin Prefecture]]
* [[Revolutionary Catalonia]]
* [[Free Derry]]
* [[Kowloon Walled City]]

== External links ==
* [http://www.spaz.org/index.php Semi-Permanent Autonomous Zone]
* [http://www.altheim.com/lit/taz/appendices.html The Temporary Autonomous Zone, Ontological Anarchy, Poetic Terrorism]
* [http://dreamtimevillage.org/articles/permanent_taz.html Permanent TAZs] by [[Hakim Bey]]
